results.definition: of or relating to a practical subject that is organized according to scientific principles
of or relating to technique or proficiency in a practical skill
examples: his technical innovation was his brushwork
the technical dazzle of her dancing

results.definition: (basketball) a foul that can be assessed on a player or a coach or a team for unsportsmanlike conduct; does not usually involve physical contact during play
of or relating to or requiring special knowledge to be understood
relating to or concerned with machinery or tools
a pickup truck with a gun mounted on it
resulting from or dependent on market factors rather than fundamental economic considerations
examples: analysts content that the stock market is due for a technical rally
the fall is only a technical correction

results.definition: characterizing or showing skill in or specialized knowledge of applied arts and sciences
examples: highly technical matters hardly suitable for the general public
producing the A-bomb was a challenge to the technical people of this country

results.definition: according to strict interpretation of the law or set of rules
